[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 215-217] [DST collision] Can the same DST be used in other parts of the Aptos codebase, allowing proof replay attacks or breaking the random oracle assumption? (Medium)

(Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 301] [Unsafe random points] The test uses unsafe_random_points() for encryption keys - does this introduce weak keys that don't reflect real-world security? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Integration] [Public parameter mismatch] Can validators use different PublicParameters (different G or H), causing encryption to succeed but verification or decryption to fail? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Crypto] [Small subgroup attack] Are encryption keys validated to have the correct order, or can low-order points in eks cause small subgroup confinement attacks? (Critical)
